results.title: ‘House of the Dragon’ Stars Say Goodbye to HBO’s Biggest Hit
results.abstract: In a joint interview, Milly Alcock and Emily Carey discussed their now-completed stint in the HBO epic. “We were forced to hang on to each other for dear life,” Alcock said.

media.caption: “We’re very lucky in that we get along in real life, so the chemistry came very organically,” Carey said.
media.copyright: Kalpesh Lathigra for The New York Times

results.abstract: Mr. Syed, 41, had been serving a life sentence for the 1999 murder of his high school classmate Hae Min Lee. The judge gave prosecutors 30 days to proceed with a new trial or drop the case.

results.title: Justice Dept. Charges 48 in Brazen Pandemic Aid Fraud in Minnesota
results.abstract: The defendants were charged with stealing $240 million intended to feed children, in what appears to be the largest theft so far from a pandemic-era program.

media.caption: The indictments said the defendants had pulled in millions of dollars a week by taking money from federal anti-hunger programs for meals they never served.

results.title: Videos Show Trump Allies Handling Georgia Voting Equipment
results.abstract: The footage raises new questions about efforts by Trump affiliates in a number of swing states to gain access to and copy sensitive voting software after the 2020 election.

results.byline: By Oliver Whang and Maddie McGarvey
results.title: A Rural Doctor Gave Her All. Then Her Heart Broke.
results.abstract: Physicians suffer one of the highest burnout rates among professionals. Dr. Kimberly Becher, one of two family practitioners in Clay County, West Virginia, learned the hard way.

media.caption: Dr. Kimberly Becher left a meeting at the Braxton County Health Department in Sutton, W. Va. in July. One of only two family doctors in the county, Dr. Becher was diagnosed with a stress-related heart condition during the pandemic.

results.byline: By Rachel Sugar and Jane Dickson
results.title: For New Yorkers, 6 p.m. Is the New 8 p.m.
results.abstract: Why are restaurants in the city filling up at hours that were once unfashionably early?

media.caption: Jane Dickson’s “Odeon” (2022). Since the 1970s, for her series “Times Square & the City at Night,” the New York-based artist has depicted iconic venues and their signage by visiting them after dark; for this version, made exclusively for T, she stopped by the Odeon in TriBeCa during its now-bustling twilight hours.

results.adx_keywords: Murders, Attempted Murders and Homicides;Education (K-12);Domestic Violence;Dating and Relationships;Koenig, Sarah;Syed, Adnan;Lee, Hae Min (1980-99)
results.title: ‘Serial:’ Season 1
results.abstract: A high school senior named Hae Min Lee disappeared one day after school in 1999, in Baltimore County, Md. A month later, her body was found in a city park. She’d been strangled. Her 17-year-old ex-boyfriend, Adnan Syed, was charged with murder, and within a year, he was sentenced to life in prison. The case against him was largely based on the story of one witness, Adnan’s friend Jay, who testified that he had helped Adnan bury Hae’s body. But Adnan has always maintained that he had nothing to do with Hae’s death. Some people believe he has been telling the truth. Many others don’t.

results.adx_keywords: Russian Invasion of Ukraine (2022);Putin, Vladimir V;Russia;Ukraine
results.title: Putin kept Russia and the world waiting hours for a speech that never happened.
results.abstract: The Kremlin did not explain why it was delayed — or even that it had been planned at all. But the caginess telegraphed the rapid speed — and apparent improvisation — with which Moscow is plotting out its next moves.

media.caption: A Ukrainian soldier in Kupiansk, where the Ukrainian military pushed Russian forces back across the Oskil River in recent days.
media.copyright: Nicole Tung for The New York Times
